Feind der Daedra
Gläubiger Trinimacs
Ein Altmer Krieger und Händler patrolliert zwischen Einsamkeit und Rifton. Normalerweise hilft er gern...
Trinimac ist ein elfischer Gott, der Bihänder bevorzugt und die Menschheit hasst.
Ein bekannter Hochelf names "Idrinth Thalui" kann helfen Fähigkeiten übernatürlich schnell zu verbessern, aber nur einige Fähigkeiten können davon profitieren.
Idrinths Meinung ändert sich mit der Zeit. Sollte er Entscheidungen nicht mögen, wird er sogar eigene Wege gehen!
Idrinth ist kein Freund von Dieben und Mördern. Vielleicht meldet er es nicht, aber er bleibt auch nicht lang...
Angreifen und ermorden von Unschuldigen ist keine Gute Idee wenn Idrinth dir folgt, bekommt er es mit, kann er dich verlassen.
Vor langer Zeit lebten die Altmeri Götter unter den Elfen. Allerdings wurden einige dieser Götter nicht ins imperiale Pantheon übernommen.
Sollte ein Kopfgeld auf dich ausgesetzt sein, können ein Altmer mit dem Namen Idrinth Thalui oder Riftons Diebesgilde dieses begleichen.
Idrinth Thalui is an ancient Elf who knows a lot about the world of Tamriel. If you find yourself in his good graces, he might just answer some of your questions...
Du willst für die Mutter der Nacht morden? Idrinth wird das nicht gefallen...und seiner Klinge noch weniger.
Einige Vampire verbergen ihre wahre Natur, währen Andere sehr offen mit dieser umgehen. Stell sicher, dass du weist, was dich erwartet wenn du Sanguinare Vampiris vernachlässigst.
Idrinths Aufgaben
Finde Thalmorbefehle
Gib Idrinth Zeit um die Thalmorbefehle zu verstehen.
Kehr zu Idrinth zurück um den nächsten Schritt zu erfahren.
Töte alle Thalmor in der Mondschmiede
Rede mit Idrinth über eine Belohnung
Informiere ein Weisslaufwache über die Schmiede
Hole idrinths Belohnung ab
Warte auf Idrinths nächste Aufgabe
Idrinth ist hier!
Eorlund is an excellent blacksmith. Honour your weapon.
Eorlund is not a great talker. He and Farkas could make a no talk contest.
It won't hurt you to clean up your stuff yourself. Tilma is busy enough cooking for the pack.
I wonder if Tilma has some mer blood in her veins? She must be at least 80.
Tilma is a kind soul. Do not make her life harder.
I am surprised Tilma is still keeping Jorrvaskr clean. She did that for years when Eorlund was a child.
You heard the story about Kodlak and Skjor fighting 101 Orsimer? It was a dozen, but you know how stories grow...
I worry about Kodlak. He... smells sick, yet tries to hide it.
Kodlak looks ill. He wasn't like that a year ago.
Kodlak is a good man. And good at reading other people's intentions.
I remember Kodlak's predecessor, Askar. He was more careful around me.
Torvar's people are said to live in Solitude. I heard he had a lot of money problems.
Farkas may look similar, but he is a good warrior. Not like Torvar.
Torvar is the typical Nord. Drinking, boasting, brandishing his weapons.
I wonder if Torvar mistook Jorrvaskr with a mundane Sovngarde?
Torvar joined the Companions about a year before Ria.
As long as Ria is considered a whelp, Vilkas would never consider a relationship.
It looks like Ria has her eyes set on Vilkas. I wonder if he even noticed?
Ria seems not sure about her fighting style yet.
Ria is really new. I hope she keeps her enthusiasm.
Strange how often Njada fights with Athis. Is that her way of saying she likes him?
I trained with Njada a few times. She is one sturdy fighter.
Do not take Njada's words too harshly. She likes you, she just can't show it.
Njada is an excellent fighter. She is just used to stand alone.
Do not fret about Njada's behaviour. She... had a rough life.
I will not comment on any relationship rumours between Skjor and Aela.
I had a few talks with Skjor. We... respected each other.
When Skjor joined, the twins took him as their new father.
Skjor always was a good teacher. Harsh but fair.
It took me years to convince Skjor I am not a thread. I suspect Kodlak had a talk with him.
Skjor joined after the Great War. He... did not like me at first.
Athis always had a hard time fitting in. First the Great War, then the Stormcloaks...
Athis worked hard for this. I saw him struggling not to use his magic several times.
Athis is more Nord than many a drunkard claiming to be a true Son of Skyrim.
Athis joined the Companions during the Great War. I never asked him why.
Aela went on bear hunts when she was about Braith's age.
That young girl once shot the deer I was stalking for dinner.
I guess Aela never had other kids to play with. They were rarely in town.
Aela was always a good archer. Her father trained her well.
Heimskr tried to convince the twins they were of Ysgramor's bloodline. They found it funny.
Aela and her father lived in a cabin in Falkreath. I saw them sometimes.
I think they were six when they killed their first skeever.
Jergen was a good man. He rescued the twins from necromancers who killed their parents.
You do not want to know how often the twins let the old Battle-Born bull run loose.
I rescued them once out of a troll cave - they wanted to hunt a wumpus. With wooden swords.
Once some kid stole Vilkas' book...it took Kodlak, Jergen and me to stop the twins taking revenge.
When I came back after the Great War, Farkas and Vilkas ran straight up to me and wanted to play with me again.
Other kids never stood a chance - the twins were inseparable.
Farkas always was gentle, but when he got angry or wanted to defend his brother, he'd fight anything.
He doesn't like to hear it, but Vilkas always got in trouble. Too smart for his age, that boy.
They always begged me to try out my sword. You should have seen how proud Farkas was when he could raise it.
I remember when another kid mocked Farkas for being as stupid as a mudcrab...good thing I was there to keep Vilkas back.
Ah, the days when the twins were rallying all other children to hunt me, the \
I found Farkas and Vilkas far out in the woods once. They took turns riding on my shoulders on the way back.
Farkas and Vilkas were the greatest troublemakers in Whiterun as kids. And the ones always ready to help their Elders.
Yes, what about having your feet never tire?
Yes, what about regeneration like a troll?
Yes, what about having the endurance of a hero?
Yes, what about improving your food?
Yes, what about using thunder?
Yes, what about learning faster?
Yes, what about being a bane to the undead?
Yes, what about harming the undead?
Yes, what about being quicker on your feet?
Yes, what about being harder to tire?
Yes, what about being stronger?
Yes, what about killing mages quicker?
Yes, what about healing faster?
Do you have any spells to teach for 500 Septims?
It's all about balancing the elements.
Can you show me how to destroy my enemies?
If I happen to find any sweets, do you want them?
I heard about the camps in Elsweyr. The Thalmor have those on the Isles, too.
If you ask me, the Thalmor got intel on when the moons will come back, and lied to you. They always do.
I know stealing is more a pastime for Khajiit than a necessity, but I prefer if you only rob bandits.
It always amazes me when Nord guards eye you suspiciously and pass me by without any comment.
Your kinspeople from the caravans are very brave, keeping up their trade routes in these days.
If you want to eat moon sugar, do it outside a city. The Nords do not understand it's religious meaning.
Elsweyr is a beautiful place. Though a bit too sunny for my taste.
I do hope you don't feel uneasy around me anymore? The Thalmor treated your people badly, after all.
I am sorry most of your kind are not allowed in the cities. Not all Khajiit are thieves and smugglers.
Skyrim must feel cold compared to Elsweyr. Good you have your fur.
Do say if you want me to punish people calling you a giant goblin again.
If you want to know more about the history of Wrothgar - I know quite a bit.
Most people here know Orsimer from the strongholds or the occasional bandit.
Nord food is on the meat side - care for a no-rhubarb salad? With extra garlic?
It's been a long time I enjoyed a pink Zinfandel.
A welcome change to fight alongside a follower of Trinimac's Wrath.
Most people think you're mindless brutes. I do not.
Rare to see a female Orsimer outside a stronghold. Good for you.
Have you been to one of the strongholds?
Maybe you are a descendant of my uncle Sarcessar. He was a priest of Trinimac, when... you know.
Most folks might call you Orcs, but I have not forgotten your ancestry, cousin.
It may be colder than Valenwood, but Skyrimis rich with game, too.
If you know how to make You-Know-What whiskey, the Nords would love it.
I visited Falinesti several times. Last time I had to flee from the Thalmor.
Valenwood feels dark under Thalmor rule. At least 70 years ago.
A pitty Jagga is rare here.
Next time we're in Whiterun, let's have a real Bosmer dish. Elrindig would be pleased.
We should have some Bosmer bites.
Do you follow the Green Pact? Even in battle? Do not worry, I will not judge you.
I know a few places mushrooms grow in abundance, if you want to eat something else than meat.
You must miss Valenwood. We should venture through Falreath more often.
I do hope you mainly follow Azura.
Want to share a bottle of sujamma at our next stay?
I was in Ald'ruhn shortly after the eruption. It was horrible to behold.
Been to Morrowind lately? The ash still covering everything?
It still amazes me that most Nords treat you worse than me. After all, many mistake me for a Thalmor on first sight.
Wich House were you originally from?
What is your favourite dish? I loved my wife's kwama egg quishe.
With any luck we can have a saltrice risotto in the new Gnisis Cornerclub.
Ever rode on a guar?
Did you ever visit Morrowind?
I know you Argonians know a lot of seafood recipes. Care to share?
I did like the baked bananas with grated cheese.
In Eastmarch there are hot springs. Want to visit?
I heard your scales needs a regular scrubbing. Is that true?
So...which butterfly species does taste best to you?
You must miss the Marsh. We should venture to Morthal more often. It's the closest you can have in Skyrim.
How is Black Marsh? I only roamed at the borders.
Skyrim must be terrible for you. Too cold for someone with scales.
The enslavement of your people was one thing I never liked about Dunmer.
I would love to hear more about the Hist. If you are willing to share, of course.
I apologise if I appear to be too curious. I never saw someone like you.
Which language do you speak at home?
Which plants grow there? Any familiar ones here in Skyrim?
What kind of animals roam your homeland?
How does your homeland look like?
How was your childhood?
What kind of beverages do you prefer? Do you even have alcoholic drinks in your homeland?
I would love to hear more about you people's cuisine.
You must feel alone, being the only one of your kind around.
Do you follow the revered entities of Tamriel? Or are your gods different from ours?
I would love to hear more about your race.
Rare to me to not be the one standing out. No offence meant.
You may look out of place to most, but you will find your way.
I would be interested in hearing more about your homeland.
I do hope me being an elf makes your ancestors squirm.
Wich kind of mead do you prefer?
I do hope the next inn has cheese scones.
Do tell me your favourite song is not Ragnar the Red.
What do you think about the dragons?
I do hope none of your ancestors were among the draugr from the last crypt.
Do you think your fellow Nords will turn back to their ancient Nordic deities?
Be honest: How long did you think I was a Thalmor? You still do?
If you prefer milk over mead - I won't judge.
A pity neither of us will see the Snow Elven cities of old.
You were born to roam these cold lands.
Do you feel the blood of your Atmoran ancestors running through your veins?
Ah, I wish you could have seen the Crystal Tower during sunrise. It was sheer beauty.
I hope noone you love was taken to the camps.
I long to return to the Isles. But with the Thalmor, maybe I  never will.
The Isles have changed much under Thalmor rule, I fear?
I do hope you don't find Skyrim too cold for your taste.
Have you ever tasted a Golden Pear Punch?
Have you ever seen the gryphon riders circling around Eton Nir?
I loved walking through the orchards while the cherries and peaches bloom.
Which city do you hail from? Alinor? Shimmerene? Cloudrest?
Do you miss the sunset on the Isles, too?
We should sit down and talk about the Isles in the next inn.
It is good to walk with a fellow Altmer.
You Redguards do love horses. They are not my favourite kind of mount.
I wonder which of us stands out more in the snow.
Do you favour the Forebears or Crowns? Or no political side at all?
Your people are held in high regard here. After all, you defeated the Thalmor.
You should try the Bosmer take on traditional Redguard kabob.
Your traditional toad muffins taste almost like Dunmeri frog muffins.
I remember the first time I had Shrieking Cheese. I laughed so hard...
I haven't been in Hammerfell since the Great War. I would not be welcome now.
Skyrim's winter is worse than the coldest Alik'r desert night.
Which part of Hammerfell do you hail from?
Do you prefer beer or wine?
What is your opinion on the Civil War?
Which part of Cyrodiil do you hail from?
Are your ancestors more on the Nedic or Colovian side?
With all your culinary feats, I'd prefer a roast turkey any day.
I saw Tiber Septim once. And the Numidium. It was... terrifying.
I heard about the horrors Lord Narifiin unleashed upon your people. Filthy servant of the thrice cursed!
I understand why the Concordat was signed. I think it was a mistake.
If I may ask: Who would claim the throne after Titus Mede II?
Does it feel strange for you to roam about the \
Which city state are you from?
I do not need any fancy food like fox or lark tongues. Do you?
Had a halibut soup in Daggerfall once. I still remember the exquisite taste.
You do not have any volcanic reaper peppers with you, by chance?
I guess if Skyrim breaks free from the Empire, High Rock will follow suit?
Your people have been though a lot - too elven for most humans, too human for elves.
I think it's a tragedy your Forsworn cousins follow the Daedric Princes their Ayleid masters worshipped.
Did you ever get called pointy ears by a Nord?
I did see Tiber Septim once, from afar. If he was a Nord, he was a very short one.
What is your opinion about the Forsworn?
The nobility in High Rock reminds me of the Altmer nobility back in my youth.
So, you are from High Rock, I presume?
But mom...
And he did right. You do have my thanks. Please help my Thorald once again. And you, Avulstein, we have to talk.
Yeah, and scolded us on the way for being careless...
I killed the skeever, healed them and brought them to the main gate.
I see. And then?
They wanted to pet a skeever and got bitten.
Let him talk, Avulstein.
It was Idolaf's idea...
I found them outside Whiterun. Thorald, Avulstein and Idolaf.
*sigh* You are more reasonable. Please tell me.
Mom...we...nothing happened...
My boys had trouble with a skeever?
Ah, nothing, mother. Really.
Skeever?
Ha, then Thorald will be safe! Like back when we encountered the skeever and...oh.
Yes. And I will help you again.
Wait, I know you...I was a child...you helped us.
May Talos protect him. And you.
I swear by Trinimac that I will bring Thorald back home safely. If he is still ... you know.
Yes. You're right.
And we better not tell your mother about Northwatch Keep. She'll only worry more.
Believe me. I know how they treat those who oppose them on the Isles. They are monsters.
They are a constant thread to all true sons and daughters of Skyrim! How...
Way older than you can imagine, child. And I know what the Thalmor are truly capable of. Their presence in Skyrim is harmless.
200 years...by Talos, how old are you?
The Thalmor are my enemies as well. They hunted me since they rose to power, 200 years ago.
I do not understand... you are a High Elf. And yet you help Thorald?
Finally out of that place...
Finally out of that place...
And send her our love.
Oh, I will. And make sure she gets my message.
Make sure to reach Windhelm safe and sound. Or your mother will never stop blaming me.
I thought they were just bandits in black...I will heed your advice.
A word of advice: Be careful around the higher ranked Thalmor. They had centuries to hone their skills.
Great Talos...
By the gods...
Once. And his Imperial Battlemage. From afar.
Did you see Tiber Septim?
No. But there are still some on active duty who remember the Crisis. And a handful who remember Tiber Spetim.
By the Nine, are all High Elves this old?
He's over 200 years old.
Much older than you think.
Wait, so long ago? How old are you?
During the Great Anguish. You call it the Oblivion Crisis.
That was a long time ago, right?
I have seen much since they took over the Isles. Nothing of it was good.
Thanks... you know an awful lot about them.
By the Nine!
They like to keep their prisoners up for interrogation as long as possible. I am sorry you had to endure it.
Brother, what.
Wha..! Wait, no, not again... sorry. I... some bad memories.
Sadly, most Nords don't. But hold still for a moment, I will tend your wounds...
Some are on our side, brother. I was surprised, too. And I appreciate it.
Oh. Never thought that there were High Elves that were against the monsters...
The Thalmor are my enemies, too. They hate me way more than they could ever hate you.
Wait. Aren't you the Elf who helped us with the skeever? And you just freed me from your fellow Thalmor?
Oh, I will. And make sure she gets my message.
Make sure to reach Windhelm safe and sound. Or your mother will never stop blaming me.
I thought they were just bandits in black...I will heed your advice.
A word of advice: Be careful around the higher ranked Thalmor. They had centuries to hone their skills.
By the gods...
Once. And his Imperial Battlemage. From afar.
Did you see Tiber Septim?
No. But there are still some on active duty who remember the Crisis. And a handful who remember Tiber Septim.
By the Nine, are all High Elves this old?
Much older than you think.
Wait, so long ago? How old are you?
During the Great Anguish. You call it the Oblivion Crisis.
That was a long time ago, right?
I have seen much since they took over the Isles. Nothing of it was good.
Thanks... you know an awful lot about them.
I know. They like to keep their prisoners up for interrogation as long as possible. I am sorry you had to endure it.
Wha..! Wait, no, not again... sorry. I... some bad memories.
Sadly, most Nords don't. But hold still for a moment, I will tend your wounds...
Oh. Never thought that there were High Elves that were against the monsters...
The Thalmor are my enemies, too. They hate me way more than they could ever hate you.
Wait. Aren't you the Elf who helped us with the skeever? And you just freed me from your fellow Thalmor?
I am glad Avulstein does not know how dangerous the Thalmor really are - he'd be sick with worry.
I hope one day Thorald will be able to sleep without nightmares haunting him constantly.
They were wild at play, like any child, but they are good boys. And kindhearted.
I hope Fralia never finds out about that bear cub... Eorlund made me promise not to tell her. Ever.
It happened more than once that I tended to their bruises and helped them clean up ere going home.
Thorald and Avulstein were often the first to see me when I got into Whiterun. Always playing \
with me...
I remember the day Avulstein and Idolaf were hunting a skeever. I had to save them from it, and heal their wounds. They were like brothers as kids.
In summer you can't distinguish the woods of Falkreath from the woods of Bruma.
Always nice to roam the woods of Falkreath. I love the smell after rain.
Falkreath's forests are beautiful. Rich with game. And those predators which hunt them.
The geysers of Eastmarch are where the Alto wine comes from.
Eastmarch, the Pale, the Rift and Winterhold are the Old Holds, both in history and minds of their inhabitants.
The hot springs of Eastmarch were created by the hero Wuunding, who defeated a daedra with his flaming hammer. At least that is how the legend goes.
Be careful in the fog. Hjaalmarch has lots of dangerous creatures hidden in it's swamps.
If you like mushrooms, you'll love Hjaalmarch.
When in Hjaalmarch, wear high boots.
To many, Haafingar means Solitude and nothing else.
Haafingar. A long coast full of shipwrecks, a lot of mountains, and the city of Solitude. What a contrast.
Any news from Hammerfell? I am not very welcome there.
Skyrim must look very cold to you. And I do not mean the weather.
Do not worry - bring no harm to me, and I will not harm you.
I do hope my being an Altmer will not make you hate me?
A lot of people will make the mistake to underestimate you. I will not.
You wear Hammerfell garb and wield a scimitar. I assume you are not from Elsweyr?
So you're a Dagi-Raht. I am not surprised. Your magical talents are only surpassed by Alfiq.
I love to walk the Rift in spring. Or in autumn.
The forests of the Rift are beautiful. Can't say that about the city Riften, though.
I am glad we could help her. She's always been a nice person. Drinks on me?
Let us hurry to save Thorald. I fear Avulstein and his friends will get impatient and try to save Thorald on their own lest we take our time.
Let us hurry to save Thorald. I fear Avulstein will get impatient and try to save his brother on his own. One captured by Thalmor is more than enough
I am glad you agreed to help. They are good lads. And I fear for the worst concerning Thorald... I suppose you know how to obtain the proof?
That does not sound good. These families were once best friends. And Thorald missing...I know him since he was a child. We should help Fralia!
What the Forsworn call \
are the Daedric Princes their old Ayleid masters worshipped. Oh, the irony...
The Reach has seen many magic rituals. Most of them an abomination to the Ancestors.
The Reach once was an independent kingdom bordered by the Skyrim province of Karthald.
Now I could need a Vigilant!
Fall to my blade! Again!
Did I not vanquish you before?
I will grind your black bones to dust!
Rejoin the boneyard!
Be thrice cursed!
By Trinimac, you will not corrupt me!
Great stars, leave those poor souls alone!
May Auri-El's light dissolve you!
Down with you, vile shade!
Go back to your masters!
When the northern lights reflect in the Sea of Ghosts...it feels almost like home. Only colder.
The crisp air is refreshing. And the hint of salt from the Sea of Ghosts... almost peaceful.
It is nice to walk around in Winterhold - on a sunny day, with the snow glittering like diamonds.
The plains of Whiterun are spectacular in spring - rolling hills full of flowers.
It's quite common in Whiterun hold to meet the Companions. Or Anoriath hunting for game.
It is said that the Snow Elves shunned the hill Dragonsreach is build upon.
Whiterun is the second-eldest human city in Skyrim.
They call the Pale \
. Fitting.
The Pale is a very lonely place to be outside Dawnstar or the main road.
I think I'll take my things back now!
I'm really disappointed in your lack of honour.
At least we're not in Coldharbour or the Deadlands.
I can feel a presence watching me...
Are you sure we go in the right direction?
These cairn stones all look the same.
Another of these black skeletons around?
That ghost looked familiar.
Are these bones the remains of those trapped here alive?
These bone heaps are depressing.
I liked lavender. After this - not anymore. Strange colour.
I feel it hard to keep track of time here.
These lightning bolts rattle my nerves.
An eerie light around here...
I think I knew that one. From back in the Second Era.
Great stars... may we escape from here again.
These mists never were chased away by Auri-El's light...
This unworldly graveyard frightens me.
You see these wisps? I fear these are souls shrivelled to nothingness.
Trinimac, preserve us from this dishonoured fate.
Great stars, i hope I never end up here!
What a desolate realm...
I hope I don't meet anyone I know.
The Soul Cairn is rumoured to be the place soul-trapped beings end up. A horrible fate.
Can you hear them? Countless souls lost in the mist, their screams reduced to a murmur.
The air tingles with twisted magicka.
Trinimac guard us in this wasteland.
A very depressing place, indeed.
Do not let his age-ridden impatience fool you. Nurelion is a good man. And close to his death.
He was already a great alchemist when I saw him back in Lillandril, about 250 years ago.
Without Nurelion's skills, many wounded Stormcloaks would have died.
Nurelion sometimes gives much needed potions to sick Dunmer, claiming they are worthless ones mixed wrongly by his apprentice. They are not.
I understand Nurelion's frustration. He spend more than 300 years searching for his dream, and feels his end near.
I overheard Galmar threatening to throw his brother Rolff out of Windhelm if he dares to insult Nurelion again.
Nurelion had saved Ulfric's father, Hoag Stormcloak, when he became gravely ill as a child.
This Altmer alchemist lives here longer than most Dunmer.
Nurelion is the best alchemist in Skyrim. He was one of the best in the Summerset Isles, ere he moved here. Before the Great Anguish.
Soulmate, of course!
Not sure what we would do without each other!
Glad to know you as well!
Just glad to have you by my side, friend!
A rare and happy fate.
The gods have blessed us!
A finer person than you I haven't met in a while!
And I appreciate you!
Great fighting alongside you!
An honor to server Trinimac together!
I salute you!
Sure...
Not now...
Not interested...
No.
How dare you!
I'm not interested, disgrace!
I appreciate you!
Stendarr have mercy on you!
Do I look like a daedra?
Ancestors, not you again!
Spread your justice elsewhere!
Stendarr, call them back!
Trinimac, make them see reason!
Go hunt some real dangers!
Why can't you leave me alone?
For the last time, I am on your side!
You people again?
Do not make me harm you!
Go hunt some daedra!
Trinimac, why me?
Do not make me fight you!
Why do you hunt the vampire hunter?
I do not wish to fight you!
I'm on your side!
Come by anytime.
I would be honoured, mastersmith.
I can fix that. As a thanks for my boys.
Yes. An unfortunate meeting with a bear.
Hrm. They better do. I notice your left shoulderpad is loose.
Good to hear. I hope they stay out of trouble.
Aye, Vilkas brought a letter. He and Avulstein are safe back in Windhelm.
I know...most fear them too much. Got any news from Thorald?
An honourable goal. Not many will do that. Even fewer elves.

Netches are docile, but do not provoke them.

Wolfsbane once grew here. I doubt the plants survived the ash storms.

Good they do not have any Greef. Last time I drank it, I had headaches for three days.
I wonder if they can get their hands on Kaveh?
Geldis' Sujamma is truly five times blessed.
I prefer not to drink Flin. I rather not give more money to the East Empire Trade Company.
Geldis Sadri clearly is not an innkeeper by trade. The way he scans the room... do not mess with him.
Nothing better to warm you up than an Ash yam and horker stew.
I wonder if they have Spiced root cake?
A good kwama egg quiche is always appreciated. Don't make me choose between it and a good garlic bread.
I have to ask for the famous Redoran style Hound and Rat pie. You barely taste the rat meat over the scuttle and kwama eggs.
I wonder if they got wickwheat bread?
Geldis looks more alert than your usual innkeeper. I guess he was a mercenary in his youth.
At times like this, I miss my wife... she'd love this Sujamma.
Before you ask: No, Dunmer do not make beverages out of bugs.
Ah, a typical Cornerclub. I take their variety of Dunmer cuisine is bigger than in Windhelm...
Ambarys got his hands on a casket of Velothi malbec some twenty years ago. He held one back for me. A good man, who never forgets a kind deed.
There was a delivery from Morrowind not long ago - they have saltrice risotto.
Oh, they spiced up their cabbage soup with Trama root and... is that a hint of hackle-lo?
I know, Dunmer cuisine can be even stranger than Bosmer cuisine. But I love it.
Now that is interesting: Dunmer-style vegetables served with Argonian-style fish.
Nothing against a hearty crab meat stew.
A pity that skeever does not taste as good as cave rat.
Hm. Redoran porridge. Simple yet nourishing.
Ah, that smell... I remember the last time she cooked that for me...
I have a pretty good idea where all the old horses of Windhelm end up. Dunmer love horse meat.
The farmers around Windhelm should try to cultivate some Morrowind plants, they are quite sturdy. I guess Nords are too stubborn to do that...
Last time I was here, they had one spiced root cake left. Could not bring myself to eat it, while some Dunmer kids sat outside hungry. They liked it.
Next time we're on Solstheim, we'll bring at least one barrel of ash yams and Trama roots with us.
They do try their best with the few ingredients they got.
Chicken egg quiche does not nearly taste as good as kwama egg quiche, but... where to find a kwama in Windhelm?
Can Skyrim's cabbages serve as replacement for scrib cabbages? Cabbage biscuits go well with a lot of dishes.
No, if I strayed any further, I couldn't see you anymore.
Certainly, I wouldn't want to intrude upon you!
Could you give me some space?
No, I can't walk through you!
Certainly, are you afraid of something?
Could you stay closer?
When it comes to cook or roast meat, ask a Bosmer. Just don't ask for their drinks...
Nothing against cows, but a good side of venison, marinated in red wine...reminds me of home.
They do have the best mammoth steaks in Skyrim. When it's available.
In the winter Elrindir sometimes offers a whole wild boar, slow roasted.
When they offer jugged venison, do try it. It is delicious.
I am glad they do not make bloodfroth. Who mixes blood with egg yolks and tallow?
I once tried Sun's Dusk ale. Then I heard how it was made... well, it does suit a vampire. But not this one.
If they offer Jagga - it is made from fermented pig's milk. Takes a strong stomach to be a milk drinker in Valenwood.
Mushroom-stuffed venison sure is a treat.
They serve many dishes contradicting the Green Pact, you do not have to rely solely on meat and fish.
Anoriath is one of the best hunters in Whiterun. Do try any special game dishes they serve.
Good thing they do not serve many Bosmer drinks here. Most are based on meat. No, not the honey wine one.
So far I have heard Elrindir telling five different versions of the hunting incident. He changes the tale every year.
If Lurbuk ever orders a bratwurst on bun, by Trinimac, I will make sure it is properly grilled, not cooked.
We should order venison pie, seasoned like in Hammerfell. It will drive away the cold.

Mead is fine, but I wish Jonna would sell pomegranate wine. Been quite some time since I drank one.
Potato soup...again. Any chance of cheese fries for variety?
Nords tend to eat their food less seasoned than Redguards. A pity.
Redguard cuisine uses scorpions a lot. Could they be replaced by chaurus? Too strange for your taste?
Do I smell garlic greens? No, just a normal stew.
I never tried toad muffins. Maybe Jonna will make some?

I'm glad this girl is in good hands.

They appear to be very good. I doubt most of their customers realise that.
To the ones we loved and lost. May they find eternal peace.

Trinimac preserve me! Your constant jokes are growing on me!

I will never like you, or your beliefs. But I acknowledge your prowess in battle. And your way of honour.

Guess our common goal to protect our mutual friend here makes us ... frenemies?
Hm - at least we have a common enemy in Molag Bal.

Your view of worship is quite... interesting. Sounds more like a follower of Malacath to me.

Do not worry. I will not stoop so low as to smite you in your sleep.
If you have to pray to your beloved Cursed One, do it in silence.
Don't you dare fighting behind me again, daedra lover. I don't trust you.

See to it that your minion doesn't get in the way of my blade.

Pathetic reflexes... that was only a hare running through the bushes.
A magic-using Follower of the Cursed One. Now that's something you don't see every day.
Varrick Veil. I will remember your name. For the day I carve it into your gravestone.

Trinimac, grant me the strength to endure this ... cultist.
I will watch you closely, servant of the Cursed One.
Spare me your explanations, hil av daedra.
A follower of five times cursed Boethiah? If it wasn't for my friend here, I would cut you down right here!

Udhendra would be quite useful now I think.
Karan where are you?
I should call Daen, he would be helpful!
Did you see Emparo?
I miss Ardis a bit, you can't have a more loyal companion than her.

Oh my, Admanen...

Heel, Emparo, heel!

I wonder what made you so civilised, it's a refreshing change.
Would you mind showing me how your magic works?

Would you care to share some news later?
It's interesting and rare, a Bosmer studying magic for melee.
Glad to fight side by side with you!
Do not worry, Lucien. I will not drink your blood. On my honour as follower of Trinimac.
If you ever want to know more about Altmer religion and history, I will gladly answer.
I wish you'd have seen Winterhold in it's prime. I remember a cosy little inn right on the cliff's edge... all gone now.
The city of Ysgramor. It had seen better times. You should have seen it.
Ah, Nords. Still as headstrong as their Atmoran ancestors. I wonder whom of us they fear more?
It always grieves my heart when I see those twisted shadows of the once proud Snow Elves...
I do not mind to answer any questions you have, Lucien. I have seen more things than you imagine.
Ah, I miss the times when the Snow Elves still roamed this land...I miss the times the Paragons of Trinimac visited the Isles.
The Dwemer were fascinating. I remember them, though I rarely met them.
I can feel your eyes on me. Is there anything I can help you with? Answer your questions?
I have seem many things in my time - but I never thought dragons would return.
Are you alright, Lucien? That dragon was quite the sight - and quite the challenge.
It feels good to see such an innocent soul in these dark times.
Learn more spells, Lucien. It should be easy for a bright lad like you.
I suggest more training with an actual weapon. Magicka can always be drained, and then you are powerless.
You held your ground well in that fight.
That, dear Lucien, was a deer. No need to look out for trouble.
Flavius...a very old family name. Related to the Flavius family of Kvatch back from the time of Reman?
Still up to exploring all of Skyrim, young man? Draugr are not easy to face.
Do not fret about how you fought the last time. Not everyone faces danger head on with blade swinging.
You may not be the best battlemage I've seen, but you have courage. Admirable.
So you want to explore the depths and hidden secrets of Skyrim? Beware, young man, they can be darker than you wish.
A bit nervous, our new companion. Don't you worry, I will protect you with my blade.
Ah, a young aspiring explorer from Cyrodiil. Blessings of Trinimac on you. I am Idrinth.
The stars truly blessed you with this melodic gift!
Ah, almost like back in Alinor!
By Auri-El, what a dulcet voice!
Lorkhan take you... no, wait, poor Lorkhan.
You wouldn't find the fount of harmony if I throw you into it!
Trinimac, grant me strength to endure this ordeal!
You make Mara's Singing Cats cry!
Auri-El strike me blind, I was beguiled by that Thalmor agent.
Curse Rulindil's Breton rat!

I saw the pain in his eyes, sensed his grief...I know only too well how he feels.
The information I got was from a Breton spy in the employment of Inquisitor Rulindil.
I thought my questioning was thorough.

You are brave to insult me like that.

Don't stay up too long.
I should go to bed soon.

The inns in Skyrim feel even more cosy when the weather outside is bad.

Quite comfy here. A good rest replenishes our strength.
Do all bards learn Ragnar the Red as their first song?
Nothing against a drink or two. But don't overdo it.
Fancy anything special today? I'll ask what's on the menu.
You look tired. Better rent a bed.
Ah, good to be in a warm, dry place.
I'll get myself something to drink.
I'll see you later!
I could really use some wine.
Finally some rest...
It's a simple life, one that I sometimes envy.
I like the woods around here...
Honest work with reasonable risks. Maybe something for my retirement?
Smells better than any town.
Ah, take in this scenery...
You heard that, too?
What a view...

Being away from the main roads is risky, but worthwhile.
Just stand still for a moment and listen to the birds singing their songs.

Cities are fine to visit, but I feel more at home here.
I prefer being out here.
In the mood for a little hunting trip?
What a beautiful night sky.
A nice stroll in the woods...
I prefer roaming the plains over the cities.
I wonder how long the land will survive as free as it is.
Glad to be out of the city!
Some fresh air, finally!
Caged like animals...

The Riften jail is a joke. Not one real thief in there.

A waste of space, either a crime is worth a fine, a banishment or death.
Not very secure, is it?
You are not trying to lock me in, are you?
The air here feels heavy.
You can feel the faith of the people here.
I'm not sure if I'm welcome here. Trinimac is not...I think.
Die, ruffled crone!
Your evil magic is no match for my blade!
Trinimac smite you, cursed one!
No mercy for daedra-loving witches!
Your magic won't save you, ugly crow!
Keep your claws away from me, hideous hag!
I'll throw your bones to the dogs!
Back to your grave!
My blade will end you!
Rest in pieces!
Your chitin armour is no match for my blade!
To think someone would EAT you - disgusting!
Your chitin armour won't save you!
Overgrown earwig!
Spitting venom at me? I'll end you!
Your poison won't stop me!
Yeech! I've got spiderweb on my blade!
You will not wrap me up in your web!
Jumping at me? I'll teach you!
Nasty eight-legged vermin!
This is for your webs in my beard!
Let me end your suffering.
Trinimac guide your soul.
Let me end your wretched existence.
May you find rest, fallen kin.
Trinimac curse you, you're sullying my blade!
No wonder everyone has Ataxia! You're everywhere!
Dirty cheese-nibblers!
Die, pantry raiders!
Nasty little critters!
Your charred hide is worth more than your life!
Disgusting little pests!
I'll stop you spreading more diseases!
Flea-riddled vermin!
Do not force me to fight you!
Attack me and I will show no mercy!
Give way ere I slay you!
Do not fight me, little one!
I will put you down!
My blade will end you, foul spellcaster!
Your daedric minions can't save you!
What evil are you hiding? I will end it!
Your magic won't save you!

Die, brigands!
Never should have attacked me!
I'll teach you trying to rob me!
idrinthFollowerDialogueBanditAttack

I will feast on your blood!

You want to dig for some ore?

Ah, away from that unpleasant weather.

I like it here, it's naturally beautiful.

The citizens of Dawnstar can sleep without fear now.
A good thing we thwarted Vaermina's vile plans.

This tale of recurring nightmares is a bad sign.

Frida knows all about frost-related illnesses. The more tragic she could not save her husband.
I remember Frida being a young apprentice to her parents.
The sun rising in the crisp morning mist is one of my favourite sights.
This town has seen several great battles.

Dawnstar - the thriving heart of the Pale. Admittedly, there's not much else...
I like the coast here, the sea reminds me of old times.
This city's life never seems to fade, even under current circumstances.
A bit warmer and we'd be drained already.
A few clouds wouldn't look too bad in the sky...
Let's hope Kyne stays happy now...

The wind feels refreshing.
Well, better than rain at least.
We should get out of this storm.

What a storm!
Kyne is wrathful today.
Hey, it's snowing!

We could walk past an entire Falmer army and won't see them...
I can barely see my hand in front of my eyes.
I'm not a Snow Elf...
Any longer in this snowstorm and I'll turn into an icicle.
Some snow is nice, it makes the landscape more beautiful.
Glad the rain is washing my armour clean!
A fine day, with lots of clouds.
This is what I call nice weather.
I'm glad the sun isn't shining, it can't be better.
It's a bit too sunny for my taste.
Xarxes' backside, it's hot!
We should rename the land to \

I like a bit of rain.
Starting to get wet...
Well, better lots of rain than lots of sun.

Oh my, rain again.
Madness or order is the question now.
Never thought they would fall this low. Not sure if it's a shame.

Many people think Taarie or Endarie are Thalmor spies. I bet my money on Melaran.

Erikur acts like he is the Jarl of Solitude.
Erikur's sister Gisli is the smarter one.
Erikur is a shifty man. I do not trust him.
Sometimes Solitude feels like an Imperial camp, not the capital of Skyrim.
General Tullius is the one in charge here. Elisif is too inexperienced.
If you are devout, do take your time to pray in the temple.
You can buy and sell almost everything here. A good place to prepare for long journeys.
A beautiful city, full of flowers.

I tend to be careful around the Thalmor headquarters, though they would not attack me in the middle of Solitude.

Be careful around the court wizard.

Skyrim's attempt to outshine the courts of High Rock.

The Imperial army is headquartered here. A strange choice if you ask me.
Many suspect Taarie and Endarie to be Thalmor spies. I do not.
Solitude is a lot more gleeful than one might expect.
It feels a bit like Cyrodiil. Except for the cold.
Pelagius III. was king of Solitude before becoming the Mad Emperor.
The Gray March once razed the city.

Ah, Solitude, home of the cursed Wolf Queen.

On the market place you find several food stalls.

Bits and Pieces lives up to it's name.
The Winking Skeever is always a good place to go.

Radiant Raiment is quite interesting. And the sisters are very kind - for Altmer seamstresses.
The Bards here are nothing compared to their ancestors, but still better than nothing.
I enjoy visiting the Temple of the Divines here, maybe we could?
I worked in the harbour here a long time ago.
This city has a long history.
They really made something out of this mountain.
This bridge has seen a lot of skirmishes over the ages.

Since it's the most convenient crossing of the Karth, Thalmor frequent the bridge quite often.
I tend to pass through, the Penitus Oculatus is quite inquisitive about visitors.

A proud name for a little village!
Since the Silver-Bloods rose to power, the city is changing for the worst.

The Silver-Bloods are as bad as Maven Black-Briar.

Markarth is as rotten as Riften. You just don't see it as well.

I've shunned the city since High Justiciar Ondolemar was assigned here, after the \

. Simple, yet concise.

Markarth never changes, does it?

Mornin

I really don't like it here, it smells rotten.

I'm not sure how he came to his title, he is neither a Draugr, Lich nor a Vampire.
Wuunferth the Unliving.
The smell of misty woods is refreshing.
A good place to sell off any pelts you gathered.
Falkreath and Bruma are very similar.
Falkreath's woods are rich hunting grounds. Just be careful you're not the one being hunted.
He took a fitting role to condone for his sins. The graveyard is in good care with him as priest of Arkay.
I knew I had seen Runil before. A man with many regrets. May the Ancestors grant him the peace of mind he strives for.
Runil is a brave man. If the Thalmor ever find out where he is, he will be court martialed for desertion.
Nenya is a good example how well Nords and Altmer can work together.
Nenya actually helped several times in defeating necromancers careless enough to rise the dead here in the graveyard.
Good thing Nenya is keeping Siddgeir's eccentrics at bay.
Nenya is a sensible steward, always keeping the best for the citizens in mind.
Nenya was already helping the steward of Dengeir's predecessor. It is basically her who governs Falkreath for more than 50 years.
There are always dark powers trying to use the dead resting here for their evil schemes.
I fear the only ones liking me here are the innkeeper and the alchemist.
The former Jarl honours the old ways of the Nords. He even bears them in his title of honour.
Solaf is the nicer of both brothers despite being a former Stormcloak.
The general store's owner is a former Stormcloak. Was an interesting experience buying supplies from him. Once.
I doubt I'd be welcome here if they found out what I am.
The local priest reminds me of a Thalmor battlemage who was in Sentinel during the Night of Green Fire...
Runil, the local priest, always watched me closely whenever I came by.
The city's priest of Arkay is an old Altmer - not sure what to think of him.
I guess everyone living here develops a gloomy humour.
Too many graves...and so many of them fresh.
I hope you are not picking a grave for us on the heroes' graveyard.
This city was considered part of Cyrodiil for a long time.
This city's Jarl is way too weak to rule. I hope he grows a backbone.
I like the forest, it'll be good hunting here.
This village was once famous for it's special brand of Alto wine. Sadly, that was before the Oblivion Crisis...
If you do not like Windhelm, spend the night here. The Braidwood Inn is more welcoming than Candlehearth Hall.
The mine keeps the village alive. I haven't seen pilgrims here since before the Great War.
Pilgrims do not come here anymore. A pity. The Nords are forgetting their old faith.
I remember when Kjeld was a little kid. He loved to hear stories. That stopped after the Great War broke out.
Between snow-covered Windhelm and the Aalto surrounded by hot springs...Eastmarch is truly a province of extremes.
This was always the lushest place in Eastmarch.
The Grove was much larger once, with many old, majestic trees.
So Sahloknir was the reason this place was called Dragonwood.
Did you know that this place also bore the name of Dragonwood?
There was an arena here. Wonder where it's gone?
Building a lumber mill here... the name could've given them a clue.
Kyne's Grove once was home to a great shrine to Kyne, tended by the Keepers of the Grove.
I heard Reldith plans on planting an orchard, once the Civil War is resolved.
People are amazed how well the crops grow here. But Reldith has been a farmer longer than Rorik lives.
She may not look like it, but Reldith is over a century old. She used to work on a farm in the Reach ere moving here.
When Rorik claims this town to be named after him - he means they rebuild the old village.
Reldith tends this farm since the rebuild of the village. And it clearly shows.
The innkeeper's son kept me up all night last time I was here, begging for more stories. That boy yearns for adventure.
Poor Sissel. Both her father and her sister Britte bully her all the time.
That Lemkil hates me since I stopped him beating his daughter like a madman. But he fears me too much to do something.
Between the Forsworn and the Civil War, they are quite relaxed here.
They'd be a lot safer with a wall. Or a palisade, at least.
They have trouble with Forsworn from time to time. And every now and again, lonely travellers have gone missing.
Reldith reminds me of a woman back on the Isles, way before the Second Dominion. Loved her orchards.
Do they hunt bards out of town when they sing Ragnar the Red?
There was a village named Lainalten nearby. Rorikstead used to be a single farm back then.
I wonder if the original Rorikstead was abandoned and Rorik rebuild the settlement?
Quite impressive how the crops here are much richer than anywhere else in Skyrim. I do hope it's by the grace of the gods.
Not my favourite village, it feels odd.
I doubt that anyone here will name their son Ragnar.
This village was definitely not named after Rorik - I remember this place from the Second Age.
Rich farmland - a blessing from the gods in wartorn times.
You feel it too? The people are less frightened.
Even the predators nearby are more peaceful now.
A dark cloud has been lifted from Morthal.
The city feels safer now. The evil presence is gone.
Something evil roams the swamp. I can sense it.
By Trinimac....for a moment I thought I felt another vampire.
This city has a strange feeling. Something dangerous lurks nearby.
Whichever deity watches over Morthal be praised that no Falmer lurk nearby
Be careful when leaving Morthal. I encountered chaurus close to it before.
As small as it is, the city feels welcoming after crossing the swamp.
Last year I stepped out of the inn and right into a frostbite spider. Not a nice way to start your day.
The fog and humidity from the swamp dampens the mood.
Do not fear the Jarl. Idgrod may sound like she's touched by Sheogorath, but she has the gift of visions. Though I imagine it to be a curse sometimes
There are times I prefer the swamp to the inn. Especially when Lurbuk sings.
It is safer to buy local ingredients in Lami's shop. Outside spiders and chaurus are prowling.
What I hate about this town are the spiders thriving in the swamps around it.
You find many kinds of mushrooms around here. But watch out for predators.
Swamps are not my favourite place, but the city is acceptable.
Morthal is said to be named after Morihaus Breath-of-Kyne. I only heard of him.
I may not like Falion, but he'll buy those surplus staves off you.
Falion has a shop here, if you're looking for new scrolls or books.
Lami is quite versed in alchemy, be sure to browse her shop from time to time.
The Jarl here is special, her whole family is.
A nice city, but somehow too calm and quiet.
Too soggy for my taste, but a thriving garden for any alchemist.
This constant mist is depressing.
Legend says that Aumriel, a Pale Lady haunts the moors at night. A lost Snow Elf soul, perhaps?
I wonder how many people think of the Thalmor when they hear the name Morthal for the first time?
Centuries ago, most people here were warriors. Now, it's only miners.
The first time I came here, there were two sets of Falmer armour placed at the gates of Fallowstone Hall. With their owners still inside. Welcoming..
I remember being a bit uneasy in this village, back when the Companions lived here. Most were wary of Altmer.
Without the mine, Shor's Stone would have been abandoned decades ago.
Fallowstone Hall was once more important than Jorrvaskr.
There are many explanations for the name \
Once a thriving village, now more a miner's camp. The fate of many a settlement.
Legends say the Doom Drum was an actual weapon and not only a name for Shor. If then, it would be hidden here.
Apparently this was one of the eldest places to revere Shor, whom we Altmer call Lorkhan.
I read old stories about Shor' Stone, but...they sound more fitting to a worshipper of Sanguine.
The mine here is very old.
The Worm Cult stole Wuuthrad from here to resurrect the giant Sinmur. In the end, they didn't succeed.
This was once home to the headquarters of the Companions, Fallowstone Hall.
You ever wondered what Shor's Stone is exactly?
Would you leave for the Town of Thieves if you live here?
In the morning sun Ivarstead reminds me of the villages of the Isles.
Just imagine the trees being abloom with lavender flowers, and you know how my aunt's wisteria lodge near Auridon looked.
A peaceful place to rest, and the woods are ripe with game to hunt and ingredients to gather.
I do hope this village will be alive with pilgrims again.
After you being named Dragonborn, I expect more pilgrims coming to High Hrothgar again.
A pity most young folk want to move to Riften. This village is much safer.
It still is a good place to rest from your travels.
This once was a thriving little village. And it had three inns to fit all the pilgrims.
Every time I come here, it seems more people have abandoned this village.
Haven't seen a frostheart blossom in some time. The last I found was before the Oblivion Crisis.
From what I can see, the legendary steps could use a rebuild.
Most people coming here are hunters. Pilgrims are rare nowadays.
I remember the village being larger. War has taken it's toll.
This village reminds me of a cottage in the woods of Auridon, back when... *sigh*
Ivarstead was saved by the Vestige from an evil necromancer. By Trinimac, ever heard of a good necromancer?
Last inn ere climbing the fabled 7.000 steps. Far less pilgrims now, though.
I heard a rumour that she sometimes visits the prison.
A vile end for any criminal.
She seems to like Elisif.
But how noble is her motivation?
She is a powerful daughter of the night.
She backs that up with powerful magics.
No wonder that the court is frightened of her.
She is a powerful mage.
One who has the court at her fingertips.
Sybille Stentor.
Auri-El is the chief deity of the mer pantheon.
He is now considered one of the parts of Akatosh among the Divines.
Besides being very powerful, Trinimac is his champion.
He promises the mer that they can ascend to the timeless freedom again they lost when the world was made.
Auri-El.
You can see the Red Mountain from here. Beautiful and yet so deadly.
The mine is placed on an old Nord burial ground. There was a lot of turmoil back then.
Being transferred from the East Empire Company to House Redoran was good for all citizens of Raven Rock, though many Imperials left.
I heard that Lleril Morvayn financed the restoration of the Bulwark himself, some 70 years ago. A good man.
The current Councillor inherited his post from his mother.
Both the Councillor and his second Councillor seem to be capable men.
Gifting Solstheim to the Dunmer refugees was a noble gesture from the Jarls at that time. The environment here is much better than in Morrowind.
A good thing House Redoran protects the city. Other Houses are less practical and more caught up in the bad Old Ways.
Good the mine reopened. You gave back hope to the people here.
The people here are desperate. The Ebony mine was one of the richest all around.
If it wasn't for the occasional ash storms, it would be quite homely.
There is something strange about this place. Like a bad aftertaste in your mouth.
House Redoran is my favourite Dunmer House - they are reliable, fierce warriors.
No wonder so many Morrowind plants grow here now. Fits in with the Dunmer architecture.
Last time I was here, this was a thriving Imperial military post. With far less ash.
Traitors to your ancestors.
My blood boils for their blood.
Trinimac, give me the strength to stay calm.
Can't say I'm among friends here.
I hope Jarl Vignar remembers that Altmer fought on his side, too.
Jarl Balgruuf is nice, but his children...
The Thalmor would not harm Heimskr here - he preaches and lives on the Companions' doorstep.
The city of the Companions. Though they're far from their old glory and old ways. Good for us.
The city of the Companions. Though they're far from their old glory and old ways. Good for me.
The third-oldest city of men in Skyrim, after Saarthal and Windhelm.
Ah, the Cloud District. We should venture here more often.
Dragonsreach - said to have imprisoned a real dragon. How did they stop him from burning the place down?
Whiterun's Hall of the Dead is behind the Kynareth temple. I'll wait outside.
The temple of Kynareth is a good place to meditate. And you don't hear Heimskr.
The Bannered Mare has always a free room to spare.
Fralia is a kind soul towards everyone. She always treated me with the same respect as her fellow Nords.
Is the Skyforge's guardian a hawk or an eagle?
Kyne has imprisoned an age-old evil beneath her fangs, ancient stories go.
Ancient rumours says that Kyne took over the Skyforge from Trinimac, as the Thrice-cursed felled him. Explains why the Snow Elves feared it.
Eorlund keeps his best weapons and armour for the Companions.
Ah, the Gray-Manes. Many of them were the Skyforge's smiths.
Last time Camilla's daughter Mila took over the stand for a while. It was refreshing to buy goods from the young lady.
Anoriath truly is a good hunter.
Farengar, the court mage, sells scrolls and soul gems he doesn't need.
If you tell me Belethor is an Ayleid, I would believe it.
Belethor buys and sells everything. I'm not sure he's joking about his sister.
Arcadia sells potions and ingredients. And is very keen on detecting illnesses. Last time she told me I had droops.
Better not show your face in the Huntsman after killing Elrindir's brother.
Ah, the Drunken Huntsman. A cosy little place to spend the evening. And get hunting equipment.
Adrianne is an excellent blacksmith. But the Nords only see Proventus' daughter in her.
Adrianne is an excellent blacksmith.
Surrounded by farms and good hunting grounds. You'll always find fresh food here.
From death comes life. A good choice you made. I look forward seeing the sapling grew to old beauty.
A good thing you restored the Gildergreen. Brightens the whole city.
Ah, what a heartbreaking sight. I remember the Gildergreen in full bloom.
I wonder if there are still some original parts of the Jorrvaskr?
This city was founded by Jeek of the River, one of Ysgramor's most trusted captains.
Really a trade hub, isn't it, at least good for the people.
Good range of shops for a village this small.
I'm rarely staying overnight, but the beds are good.
The inn's cook has some interesting dishes, if you're feeling adventurous.
That feisty Breton sure has a problem with Altmer - she watches me all the time when I'm in the inn. I guess some bad memories.
The innkeeper is quite the nosy one. Guess not everyone likes Altmer.
Bleak Falls Barrow really towers over it. I wonder if that was intentional?
Watching the stream from the jetty is relaxing.
A nice little village, I wish there were more of them.
I doubt Oengul War-Anvil is as good a blacksmith as Eorlund Gray-Mane. Even if they switch their forges.
Amazing how Rolff does not harass Niranye. I wonder if she pays him to leave her alone.
I wonder what she is. A Thalmor spy? An Imperial agent? Someone more shady?
This Niranye seems suspicious. Fresh from the Isles, and free to sell her goods openly in Windhelm? I seriously doubt that.
Nurelion the alchemist is a highly respected person. Niranye on the other hand...
It may sound strange, but the Altmer living here are treated better than the Dunmer.
The Nords here treat the Argonians not much better than the Dunmer two centuries ago.
It is a hard life for the Argonians at the docks. They are not made for this cold weather.
I pity the Argonians in the harbour. Cold place, cold people...
Most Dunmer here are of the fallen House Hlaalu. I heard they fled as a group and lived here for 190 years.
If you see orphaned children around - the ones who care for them are the Dunmer. Regardless who the children are.
I like to visit the Gray Quarter. Most Dunmer living there do their best to have a good life.
The Nords placed the Dunmer refugees in the poorest and coldest quarter.
The Gray Quarter was once named the Snow Quarter. You can guess why.
No wonder the Old Companions were so hateful. Living in constant Winter, in a city echoing with pain and grief...
Rolff Stone-Fist should learn a few things from the Thalmor,if he wants to harass foreigners. He's about as scary as a puppy stumbling over it's paws
One day I will thank Rolff for his warm welcome of all Elves entering the city.
As bitter and xenophobic the Nords here are - compared to Thalmor-ruled Altmer cities they are kind and welcoming.
How many people here are still haunted by the ghosts of old?
The chill winds are as cold as the Nords hearts.
It's a cold city. Founded by Atmorans burning with hate for everything meric.
I shudder to think over how many unmarked graves we walk. And most Nords do not even know...
How many dead Snow Elves were buried in the walls? I still can sense their grief.
This really feels like home, it's racist enough.
Care to join me in the New Gnisis Cornerclub? Been a while since I tasted genuine Morrowind cuisine.
As shabby as it is, the Gray Quarter feels more homely to me.
Being here always makes me uneasy - and not because of drunken louts like Rolff.
The old stones still echo with the pain of their builders.
Ah, Windhelm, city of Ysgramor. Soaked with Snow Elven blood.
Many whisper that Riften needs another good burning. Some days I concur.
Oof. That whiff of stench was particularly nasty.
I heard that the priestess of Mara asked for the children to come for prayer each Sundas. I heard she asked in vain.
Grelod the Kind - I heard she is a hagraven in human guise.
You never see the children of the orphanage running around town.
I advise you to leave my pockets alone, lest you will taste the edge of my blade...
Don't let your guard down. Check your pockets.
The last thief who tried to pickpocket me lost a hand.
The good thing about Riften is the variety of goods to buy and sell.
Balimund's forge is unique.
Madesi is an artist with gems. You won't find such craftsmanship in the rest of Skyrim.
Brand-Shei has always some little treasures from Morrowind set aside for me.
Many traders are good people. But do not trust Brynjolf.
The Jarl's sons pampered princelings, Maven's children all depraved...Riften needs new leaders.
This city needs a temple of Stendarr... Trinimac, did I actually say that?
The Black-Briars. As greedy and selfish as the Silver-Bloods.
Without the temple of Mara this city would be lost.
Too many good people living in fear.
Maven struts around like an empress.
Trinimac, this city is being drenched of it's honour.
Riften burned down about 70 years ago. No improvements yet.
The Ratway is a place for those beneath the lowlifes.
Talen-Jei has some interesting drinks. Make sure you try.
Elgrim's Elixirs is a well-sorted alchemy shop. No wonder, he is the teacher of Ingun Black-Briar.
Grelka is not the nicest person, but she'll buy anything you offer.
Balimund runs an interesting smithy. You should visit it.
Falmer blood elixir... what comes next? Dragon egg souffle?
Do not trust anything Brynjolf is trying to sell you.
Marise preserves her meat in a perfectly safe way, I smelled no foul play.
The Pawned Prawn has a bit of everything, and Bersi is an honest trader.
Madesi is a gifted gem cutter.
Brand-Shei sometimes has goods from Morrowind.
Woe unto the thief trying to pickpocket me.
The Temple of Mara is a nice place for a wedding.
The guards claim to hunt thieves, I'm not so sure about that here.
This city is owned by it's Meadery.
This city is tainted to the bones.
Some say the Thalmor called the dragon. If any Thalmor could call a dragon, all of Tamriel would know.
Some say that Ulfric called the dragon himself. If he could do that, he would have done it sooner.
If the Thalmor would have joined the fight, they could have saved some of the inhabitants. But Elenwen is a pampered coward.
Elenwen was said to have fled once the dragon appeared. Ondolemar would have stood his ground.
Elenwen was rumoured to be here the day of the attack. A pity she wasn't among the dead.
I heard some Imperial soldiers and Stormcloaks only survived by fleeing together.
It must have been a harrowing experience for the few survivors.
This was once the gate to Cyrodiil. Now it's only ruins.
A terrible fate... may their souls find eternal rest.
Most of the people here I knew as children. They were used to see Altmer in the Legion and wanted me to play with them.
I liked Vilod's mead with juniper berries.
After Ulfric's rebellion the Legion tripled their presence and instated battle mages. I visited sparsely since then.
Helgen was always a favourite of mine, simple and strong.
idrinthFollowerDialogueCityHelgenIdle
Do you get to Hammerfell often? Of course you don't...
It's amazing how his pride fits through the city gates.
He should go listen to Heimskr. At least one of them won't be talking, then.
I've seen proud Hammerfell nobles. Nazeem isn't one of them.
He advises the Jarl, so he claims. More like he advises on whether he should eat cabbages or leeks tonight.
Have you been to Hammerfell often? Of course you haven't...
Pride in gold is wasted, you can quickly lose it.
Never thought House Telvanni of all Houses would accept a non dunmer...
I still remember Argonians and Dunmer fighting...
I was never good at Alchemy, but I managed to brew some reasonable potions.
It has been a while since I travelled with an Argonian.
Glad to work with someone from Morrowind again.
I'm not sure who my favourite Argonian is here.
No wonder the Companions drink so much mead, being so close to Heimskr.
How do the Companions stand the constant preaching?
Now would be a perfect time for an Oblivion gate opening - though I fear the daedra hear him and turn to flee...
May Talos grant you and us peace...
Any chance we could shut Heimskr up?
Could we please leave?
Talos, please answer him!
Trinimac, grant me patience...
You know, Heimskr's sermons are actually enjoyable. After a whole casket of Colovian brandy.
I need some wine...
I need some mead...
Trinimac, gift me the power to ignore him...
Talos, let him lose his voice...please!
You'll make a fine shield maiden some day.
Good to see you learning the lore, not just how to hold a weapon.
Good to see you actually have an interest in the Companions besides fighting.
Care to spar? I can show you a few new moves.
Sure you want to fight with bigger swords?
Keep up your training, Ria. You are getting better.
As a follower of Trinimac, do you hate all men?
Your balance of swordsmanship with magic is dishonourable...
I'm not sure Kodlak would accept you, Idrinth...
Say, did you ever train students, Idrinth?
Another master of the blade, maybe we can learn from each other?
A good defence is commendable, but attack from time to time.
Shall I test how long you can keep up your shield?
You are a walking shield-wall, Njada.
Martin Septim's self-sacrifice to end the Oblivion Crisis was something I consider exemplary.
I don't want to die, but his death saved us all.
Surprisingly enough, Vivec is actually someone I consider a paragon.
His fight for the safety of those he protected was a great task, even for a false god.
An addition from the Great War was the Emperor Titus Mede II.
He showed a willingness to self-sacrifice for the betterment of others.
The Battle of the Red Ring showed this clearly.
A recent addition to my paragons is General Tullius.
His tactical genius is something to aspire to.
Who is your paragon among the heroes of Tamriel?
Mead is for celebrating after the battle, not before. Keep your mind clear.
Where did you learn to fight? From a woodcutter?
Be glad Farkas is such a gentle soul. I would train you harder.
Roaring and flailing your weapon may look intimidating, yet you are no match for a seasoned warrior. Or a fierce beast.
Care to spar, Torvar? You'll need the training.
Trinimac's mercy, don't hit your shield-siblings!
Don't let bloodlust overtake you.
Make sure you stay in control, Idrinth!
Let's hunt together!
Oh, too sunny?
How do the Nords in Windhelm treat you? Do they dare to question your honour as Companion?
Want to spar? Cloak and dagger will not help against greatswords.
Be a proud swordsman, you still will fight nimbly.
All too easy to fall into the darker ways of fighting when using daggers.
Good to see a Dunmer upholding the warrior's honour. Are you from House Redoran, perchance?
You have chosen a noble path, Athis. Do not sully it by your choice of weapons.
Runil was one of the opponents I feared during the great war.
He was one of the best battle mages I have seen in that war.
That he fled the Thalmor and found his calling in Arkay gives me hope for the future.
He may not be able to repay the damage he caused in a single lifetime, but neither can I.
He is a brave man to live with such knowledge and pain.
Runil.
Are you an actual priest of Trinimac or just a follower?
You are focusing on defence, just like I do. Why use a Greatsword?
Do you like mead or rather elven wine?
Could we spar later?
An honourable Altmer? I'm intrigued!
I'm glad you are on our side, I don't want to be hit by that sword!
Which skies do you prefer, Cary? Skyrim's cold beauty or the Isles' jewels on velvet ground?
I miss the old wisteria grove from my parents' estate. Do you miss your quiet place, too?
Which is your favourite place back home? I always loved my aunt's orchard and her canahs.
Are all Oblivion Gates destroyed by now?
The Ancestors truly smile on you, Caryalind.
Want to share a bottle of wine and tell me how our home fares? I long to see Alinor again.
I'd be glad if we can sit down and talk about home. I haven't been to the Isles since the Great Anguish.
You have a kind heart. A beacon of how we Altmer should strife to be.
I am always ready to spar with you, Caryalind. I can't let the only good Thallery die of sloppy fighting skills.
If you want to continue fighting with daggers, we should work on your evasion skills.
You could try learning a few healing spells. They are easier to learn and always useful.
I admit I misjudged you at first, Caryalind. It is an honour to fight with you.
You know, Caryalind, I'd be happy to help you take down the Thalmor.
I should introduce you to my great-grand-Niece, you two may become allies.
You may be the light that is needed for the Altmer to survive.
We should spend some time talking about our, no, the Aldmeri's, history!
Your father is a dangerous man, you need to grow up to face him!
Maybe you want to learn some tricks from me? They could come in handy!
If you want to learn some proper weapon, I'll help you!
Maybe you should try and practice one of the magic arts, Caryalind?
If you are serious about leaving the Thalmor, maybe this is your best chance.
I'm not sure if you are a wolf in sheep's clothing, Thallery.
I wonder why you don't use any magic, Thallery.
If you are serious about leaving the Thalmor, make hay while the sun shines.
Not many can say, they actually left the Thalmor behind!
The Pride of the Thalmor fleeing his life, as if...
A dagger is a distasteful weapon, why not take a warrior's weapon, Thallery?
For what your family has done, you should have killed yourself!
The pride of the Thalmor fleeing his perfect life? Ludicrous!
I'm not sure why I don't gut you like a fish!
Be glad our mutual friend vouches for you, Thallery!
Sun - let's see our proud Altmer handle this...
Treat me with the respect I deserve, not like a spoiled brat!
It feels weird, that there is no lady for you...there always is in stories!
You have to tell me the truth about some of the things I read!
I wonder, have you ever visited my father's court before?
I'll leave in three days time if you don't return.
I'll leave in two days time if you don't return.
For a day at most, yes.
For 12 hours at most, yes.
For 6 hours at most, yes.
No, I have more important things to take care of.
Would you wait for me?
He is the form that Trinimac was forced into if you believe the stories.
His lust for vengeance is dangerous, but he is rather honourable for a Daedric Prince.
I'm sad the Orsimer flocked to him instead of staying true to Trinimac.
It could have been a better life for them if they did.
Malacath.
He is a zealot, even among the Dawnguard, with a just cause.
A zealot none the less and those must die for the greater good.
His specific cause of ridding the world of vampires is not bad in itself, just uninformed.
There are enough vampires who are no harm to anyone, those should live.
Isran.
He is an open worshipper of Molag Bal.
His lust for domination is obvious, even in his court.
That he is an ancient vampire makes him even more dangerous than the average tyrant.
I'm not sure if his gift wouldn't have been useful in stopping him.
He is an open worshipper of Molag Bal.
His lust for domination is obvious, even in his court.
That he is an ancient vampire makes him even more dangerous than the average tyrant.
I just hope you won't follow him without asking questions and thinking for yourself.
Lord Harkon.
The Eye of Magnus is an interesting artefact.
Too bad it has been taken away by the Psijic Order.
I can't say I trust them enough to keep it and us safe.
The Staff of Magnus is an interesting artefact.
I never thought the College would ever get something this exiting!
The Augur seems to be an interesting creature.
I'll spend some time here in the future to try and study him.
He's way more interesting than most mages of flesh and bone, wouldn't you agree?
Did you read about the \
you got from Fellglow Keep?
It's history worth remembering, not worth repeating.
I'm curious about the secret found under Saarthal.

And most of us turned to whatever strength we could find.
Auridon is the second largest island in the Summerset Isles.
It is home to the cities of Firsthold, Skywatch, and Vulkhel Guard.
Artaeum, one of the isles, is the only one I have never visited.
It is home to the Psijic Order, a very powerful organisation.
Can you tell me about the Summerset Isles?
Yes, please be careful not to drink me dry.
No, I fear you may drink me dry.
May I try your blood?
I think of them as an illness, that has infected the Altmer.
Insecurity since the Oblivion Crisis and a lack of strong leadership empower them.
We all reacted too late to stop them relatively easily and quick.
Now they are settled in and will be hard to remove.
The Thalmor claim they uphold the superiority of themselves over all others.
Even other Altmer.
In the elden days, the Divine Prosecutors would have them imprisoned for heresy.
Once, many Bosmer and Khajiit were amongst the highest ranks of the Thalmor.
Hard to imagine in these dark times.
Now they are mere servants, if not less...
It grieves me to see so many bright young Altmer being turned and twisted by the vile new ways of the Thalmor.
If only they had lived in the days of yore...
The Oblivion Crisis brought out the worst of the Thalmor.
What you see is a mockery, nay a distortion of their ancient counterparts.
In the olden days, the Thalmor protected the Isles and the ideals of the Aldmeri Dominion.
And they stayed true to these goals.
But now...
Alas, how far the Thalmor had strayed from their former selves.
Under Queen Ayrenn they were the backbone of the Aldmeri Dominion, keeping us Altmer, Bosmer and Khajiit together.
They are an interesting and powerful faction.
Based on our weaknesses, they force our people into wars that drive us to extinction.
Additionally, based on our strengths, they try to destroy all opposition.
Think of them as the evil in the hearts of the Altmer.
They conquer and kill and see no reason to let any none mer live.
Also they lack individuality, they drive it out of everyone.
The Thalmor have been my enemies for as long as I can remember.
They desire a return to the past, while I desire a better future for all of us.
Worst of all, they will likely kill everyone for their goals.
The Thalmor are everything evil in us Altmer turned to the extreme.
They won't rest until they conquer and control all.
And that is the best case, worst case they will kill all non-mer.
Can you tell me more about the Thalmor?
You're my soulmate.
You're a good friend, why do you ask?
You're a friend, why do you ask?
It's no shame to walk beside you.
No, you are a disgrace.
Do you like me?
I don't trust you enough yet.
I trust you enough, hold still.
You are a vampire, right? Can you turn me?
The recent increased interest in my family by the Thalmor worries me.
I'm unsure how they made the connection.
I'm glad that there seems to be light in my family, hope.
They are in a dark place now, but they'll survive, they always have.
My family still exists, but I doubt they want anything to do with me officially.
Some are Thalmor, but the leaders at least see me as a black sheep of the family.
That is why I won't give out my house name, no reason to endanger them further.
My brother rose far in military ranks in a short time.
He profited a lot from the ones turned to Orsimer leaving.
My love for Chimer cuisine is based on my family.
My former wife was a good cook.
Now Dunmer cuisine is the closest it gets.
I don't have the best relationship with my blood family. We disapprove of each other's god.
My blood mother, a Nord, had a thing for mer. A lot of my brothers and sisters are mer.
My blood family has spread through all of Tamriel, it's not unlikely we will meet one of those Molag Bal worshippers.
My family doesn't share my last name, since that is more of a title given to me.
There is no family in Skyrim right now as far as I know.
My sister may be long dead, but she had children.
Some of her descendants are still alive and well.
They sometimes send letters asking for advice and talking about their lives.
My former wife and I split after a few years, but stayed in contact.
I lost my wife to time, she died of old age, never accepting the blood kiss.
My former wife was once the centre of my life.
My father died because he worked too hard, never took enough of a break.
My mother is dead, she lived a long, fulfilling life.
I never had children, just never had the chance to get any.
What about your family?
This is madness.
Fingers where I can cut them!
You dare?
I was once married to one of your people. The love of my life.
Mara hasn't blessed me in a long time.
Hopefully not!
Only to my sword now.
No, I once was.
Not anymore, it was a long time ago. I still love her though! Would you return the ring?
Are you married?
Won't happen again!
Ouch!
Out of my way!
Beg your pardon?
Sorry!
The thirst is strong, but you can live with it.
Like everything else, it's a two-edged blade.
I like the time it gives a lot.
As long as you drink from those you kill, it's no harm to anyone.
Well, it can be a blessing, you know?
What do you think about Vampires?
Voice it!
Here we go again.
Your Thu'um is powerful!
I wonder if I could learn it?
Feels great, right?
Glad you don't need that on me!
No need to share, right?
Strengthening myself is also my way.
Ah, praise the warmth of Magnus' rays!
If we ever tell stories around the campfire, pray do not tell any about Argonians in maid outfits.
Want to know more about Skyrim's history? Ask away.
Do you prefer camping in the open or a bed in a cosy inn?
Ancestors, do let the next bard not sing Ragnar the Red.

Horker may be slow on ground, but deadly in the water.

Quite a lot of butterflies here. I do hope they are only searching for nectar.
Have you seen that butterfly? Was that a Green Slipper-Tail?
What is more beautiful? The sunset or the moons lighting up the night sky?
Such a fine night...Trinimac, with our luck there's a group of draugr waiting around the next corner.
I wonder how many tales of lurking draugr sprang from Falmer prowling around reclusive homes?
The draugr are getting more restless. I rarely saw one outside their tomb a decade ago.
The Nords should be grateful that the Snow Elves do not walk around like their draugr. Skyrim would be full of undead mer.
How many Nords have mistaken Falmer for a kind of goblin?
Some tales tell of the souls of cursed Snow Elves wandering forever in the frozen wastelands.
I wonder what happened to all the Snow Elven treasures the Atmorans plundered. Did they melt them down and remade them to their liking?
This land was once called Mereth - the Land of Elves.
Troll trophies are an impressive sight. But make sure to wash the pelt. Several times.
When hunting trolls, keep fire ready. Stock up on torches.
If a frost troll keeps quiet, you're in for an unpleasant surprise in the snow.
I have seen troll dolls. Clearly made by someone who never encountered a troll.
Children stories tell of trolls hiding under bridges and taxing all who want to cross it.
Does it smell like troll here?
A sabre cat makes a fine trophy.
Sabre cats are fierce predators.
A good day for a brisk walk.
You know I could walk on all night, but what about you?
